conclusion: Analyze the image to understand the flow path of the liquid through the baffles.
Identify the connections between the containers to determine which container the liquid will flow into.
The image shows containers labeled A, B, C, D, E, F, and G with arrows indicating the flow of liquid.
Containers D, E, F, and G are arranged in a row at the bottom.
Arrows and lines connect the containers, suggesting the flow path of the liquid.
Liquid flows out from containers A, B, and C.
Arrows indicate that the liquid from A flows into E.
Liquid from B flows into F.
Liquid from C flows into G.
The question asks which container the liquid will flow into after passing through baffles.
Based on the connections, liquid from A goes to E, liquid from B goes to F, and liquid from C goes to G.
Liquid from A, B, and C will flow into the containers directly connected to them after passing through baffles.
Therefore, the liquid will flow into containers E, F, and G.
